intro: Alkanna haussknechtii, commonly known as the Hausknecht's alkanna, is a species of flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its distinctive orange-red roots, which are often used in traditional medicine. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
